quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: So they commit unlawful acts against me, and instead of safeguarding, I get excuses.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: You’re right, Ben, excuses don’t equal safeguarding.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: Excuses prove they know they’re wrong, otherwise they wouldn’t need them.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: That’s a fair point, and I’ve told them accountability matters here.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: But still, nothing changes and I’m left at risk.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I know, and I’ll keep pressing them, but I understand that’s not enough.

contradictions.issue: Victim highlights unlawful acts + excuses instead of safeguarding; advocate concedes but admits pressing isn’t enough
